result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared M Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 10:29am. [MK]
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Owens makes a statement. 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Owens on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both drugs and alcohol
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and for incidental contact as necessary for employment or educational programming as approved by the Agent
--to undergo random drug screening as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $50 in drug testing fees, plus $334 in subpoena fees


Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 10:46am
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.
With elements

case called at 2:39pm. 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated including as to the prior conviction; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3. 

On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule sentencing on a later date, to allow time Mr. Owens to complete the AODA assessment that was ordered in Mr. Owens' previous cases. 
The Court adjourns, but directs Mr. Owens to discuss with the Agent having the assessment done; he should also start efforts, on his own, to have the assessment done.
Mr. Owens verifies that the W. Haven Drive, Watertown address is current.
The Court reminds Mr. Owens that the bond and its conditions remain in effect.
recess 2:45pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing in December

Attorney Lunchsinger informs the Court that there is no resolution on case 14CF143.
On case 14CF155 the Court makes record of side bar conducted that the 9/25/14 Jury Trial.
[Court proceeds to Sentencing Hearing in cases #13CF367 and #14CF155.]
recess 10:25am.

Jury trial on November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

[MK]
During a hearing on this date in Case #14CF155, State -v- Jared M. Owens, the scheduling of this case #14CF143 was addressed:  
Defendant Jared M Owens was in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber informed the Court and Defense that the State is in the #1 position for the State Crime Lab Analyst for this case on 9/26/14. 
After discussion with counsel, the Court removed the 9/22/14 FSSC in Case #14CF143 from its calendar because it is not needed. The Court clarified that the Jury Trial remains on the calendar for next Friday 9/26/14.

Case called at 10:28 am [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Jared M Owens in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addresses Mr. Owens letter re: representation. Mr. Owens informs the Court that he is no longer concerned with Atty Luchsinger's representation

cases #13CF367, #14CF143, and #14CF155 called at 10:05am. (separate minutes for each case) 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court receives the stipulation of counsel that on April 15th, 2014 Mr. Owens was under bond in case #13CF367 and that Mr. Owens was aware of the bond and its conditions.
Deputy M. Wolff  -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--examination by the Court
Det. Chad Garcia- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--redirect examination by ADA Shock
--examination by the Court 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Owens committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

ARRAIGNMENT: 
Service of the Information admitted; reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered.  
The Defense demands speedy trial.
recess 10:31am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/4/14 at 2:20pm  (2) schedule FSSC and Jury Trial within the 90 day time limit

Cases 13CF367 & 14CF143 called together at 2:22 pm 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Motion to Suppress:
Atty Luchsinger: Do intend to proceed with motion to suppress, but do agree with State that evidence is retained in preliminary hearing transcript
ADA Teuber: Agreed, can mark transcript - 2 issues, THC on person and then following vehicle search 
Arguments presented by Counsel
Court presents basis and informs parties that It will take under advisement

On State's Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented
Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond in each case

13CF367: The Court requires a $300 CASH bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 

14CF143: The Court requires a $1,000 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
Court reviews conditions with Mr. Owens and he indicates that he understands conditions
Recess: 2:49 pm

Case called at 1:16 pm
Defendant Jared M Owens in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1- #3.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
